title: The Rationalistic Frame is Self-Contradictory: Barfield, Polanyi and Esther Lightcap Meek on Knowing
description:
Notes on the talk with Michael re Michael Polanyi and Esther Lightcap Meekwith links to pertinent videos.

Knowledge v. Information

JBP - A vision of the desirable future links action in the NOW w important long-term foundational values. It provides a frame limiting anxiety and uncertainty.”

Michael: The rationalistic frame is self-contradictory.
Barfield - the philosophy of the arts and Polanyi - the philosophy of science
Both were striving to answer the question of knowing.
Michael Polanyi - “A free society that strives to be value neutral undermines its own justification. But it is not enough for the members of a free society to believe that ideals such as truth, justice and beauty, are objective. They also have to accept that they transcend our ability to wholly capture them.” The objectivity of values must be combined with acceptance that all knowing is fallible.  Polanyi denied that minds are reducible to collections of rules.

The structure of Tacit Knowing. We experience the world by integrating our subsidiary awareness into a focal awareness.

Esther Lightcap Meek
“Knowing is the responsible human struggle to rely on clues to focus on a coherent pattern and submit to its reality. Much of the pattern-making process is inarticulable.
Knowing requires more than words.

The false dichotomies
Fact - Value
Reason - Faith
Mind - Body
Theory - Application
Default setting due to our western view.

How do you teach a child to ride a bicycle? A new paradigm of knowing'
My efforts at knowing are a way of developing a relationship with that which is yet to be known.
JBP’s paradigm of known/unknown/knower
Esther Meek:  
"Invite the real." The dance as Reality calls you forward into relationship...

If you want to know how to fly a fighter jet, you must do your time. Invest in putting yourself in a position to access the real.

Reality graciously self-discloses to people who put themselves in the place to see it, to invest that time.

Knowing God is similar to knowing your auto mechanic.
Videos of Esther Meek
https://youtu.be/wAt4epHvXQY

https://youtu.be/5fM9upsv3Pg
“Hope of future possibilities testifies that you’ve made contact with reality.”

KW:  And conversely, knowing your auto mechanic is like knowing God. This goes to JBP’s art of listening, art of getting to know another person, or truly cleaning your room, or truly developing a skill.  If you truly pursue any of these things as far as you can take them, one deep symbol after another, deeply nested all the way down will begin to open up to you and also, the truth will unfold. AND you being to see yourself in a new way, recognizing your own known and unknown parts, your hamartia - that which misses the mark. 

Blaise Pascal - the spirit of geometry and the spirit of finesse, both are active, simultaneously, all the time, but the west has privileged the spirit of Geometry.
If you can’t provide an equation for your knowledge, it will be discarded.
Michael sees this as an outgrowth of the Reformation with the need to become more and more correct and to get things into ever smaller boxes.

Michael:  Plus, when we are only taking in from the world (binging on Netflix, etc.), this hides the errors of our thinking from us. 
As JBP says, the Transcendent reveals itself to you in error.
So, if we do not see our error, we will not see the Transcendent.

When we look only at knowledge as information and neglect feelings, intuitions, emotions, perceptions, we are neglecting the fundamental issue of science.
“Why did you become a scientist? What did you love that led you to the questions you are seeking to answer? Where does that passion come from? To be a scientist requires a love of the search. The questions bubble up from the bottom of the iceberg.”  Michael

From D. C. Schindler (Surprised by Truth), Reason leads us to surprises beyond itself. Philosophy and all knowledge begins in wonder.  The What If? At the heart of everything is some sort of mystery, our relationship to the unknown.  
However, the new atheists whittle everything down into smaller and smaller boxes.
D. C. Schindler, The Last Lecture:  https://youtu.be/JRgkRcHHQ7c

It is impossible to do any learning without humility, for if you already know all the answers, you have no relationship with the unknown.

Dramatic truth unfolds itself to us over time, like a story does.  The analogy here to DNA writes itself. New plot points re-inform the meaning of the story as it goes along.
Random is just another word for a pattern we aren’t smart enough to figure out.

Ephesians:  God’s manifold wisdom, all things will come together in Christ.

God is unchanging but that doesn’t have to mean static.  Rather, unchanging can mean faithful and faithful allows for a dynamic future with an unfolding relationship.

Paul Davies on The Demon in the Machine:
https://youtu.be/favrMbfi1Pw
